name: heat production, untreated waste wood, at furnace 1000-5000 kW, state-of-the-art 2014 | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12941/documentation

This activity represents the combustion of untreated waste wood chips (eqivalent to natural wood chips from forest) in Switzerland in new (=installed in 2014) boilers  suited for waste wood combustion and is used for the global activity as first approximation with uncertainty factors adjusted accordingly. Equipped with an industrial electrostatic precipitator in order to comply with PM emission regulation. LHV of waste wood: 13.99 MJ/kg. Air emission factors as well as the boiler efficiency represent average annual operation including start and stop (warm-up and shut-down). Therefore, emission data will be higher and efficiency will be lower than rated values provided by manufacturers. The inventory shall be considered as being representative for boilers with nominal capacities above 1 MW. 

from delivery of waste wood

This activity describes the combustion of untreated waste wood chips, corresponding to natural wood from forest. Included are the infrastructure, the wood requirements (LHV=13.99 MJ/kg), the emissions to air, the electricity needed for operation, and the disposal of the ashes.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Key emission factors PM, CO, NMVOC, NOx, CH4 as well as the average annual efficiency have been updated using the latest available information. Other emission data are from the second half of the 1990Â´s.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: LCI data for Switzerland were used for the GLO activityy as first approximation with uncertainty factors adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Modern boiler technology available on the Swiss market, installed in 2014.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description: The numbers used in the mathematical relation refer to the input of one MJ of fuel with the heat output depending on the efficiency of the furnace. Using the "scaling factor" (inverse of the efficiency) allows for scaling of the amount of the reference product to 1.

flow.name: heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas
